title: Jatiluhung
author: Jatiluhung
content: I had an adventure in this forum and when I was on the reputation board I read a thread and someone responded to the thread suggesting that the OP should moderate the post by the OP himself.Then I thought whether it could create a topic which myself as the moderator in my writing?if so, where can i find the method?please show and i will be very grateful.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: When you're writing your topic (before posting it) scroll down and look for additional options and then tick the "self-moderated" checkbox.

comments.author: Beparanf
comments.body: Use the image below to see the exact button of self moderate feature on your ANN thread. Just follow what @Omegastarscream instruction above and use the image below to see it in actual. I hope it helps.

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: In addition what @OmegaStarScream have been mentioned above.You can moderate self-moderated thread to delete other user post, but you shouldn't abuse it by using that's power if someone disagree with your thought. Constructive criticism post is considered as high quality post too and this forum has free speech. I don't know what's your purpose to create self-moderated thread, if you can't moderated a thread you can still report to moderator and let them decide.AFAIK certain boards doesn't let you to create self-moderated thread, so don't surprised if you didn't find it.

"Is this feature (moderation by myself) free to use on every board, or can it only be used on certain boards?"Self mod feature is restricted on certain boards like Meta, Scam Accusations, Important Announcements, and Auctions. And once you create a thread (which allows self mod) without activating the feature, it is not possible to make it self moderated.Here's a quote from theymos;Quote from: theymos on March 14, 2013, 06:09:28 AMThe excluded sections are Meta (except for this topic), Scam Accusations, Important Announcements, and Auctions. Tagged scammers can't use this feature. You don't have to participate in self-moderated topics if you're worried about manipulation by the OP.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Some of my threads are self-moderated and it's neat feature to have. Sometimes I forget to tick the option and at other times I intentionally don't want a self-modded thread. I personally don't like to see self-moderated threads when money is at stake or someone's reputation. People might question your motives if you are moderating such threads yourself. It makes it look like you are trying to hide something. But with the bots we have scrapping the forum nowadays, that's practically impossible to do. I also remember seeing reputation threads or accusations against a person or group in threads that were self-moderated and had local rules that restricted those individuals from posting. That doesn't make much sense. You don't accuse someone of something but don't allow them to share their side of the story so that the community can approach the issue in a neutral way.
